body:
I was able to reproduce the issue. It looks like the model-version page assumes that the artifact directory the model version is associated with contains an `MLmodel` file:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17039389/194232852-eefed5c1-95a4-465e-907f-7170a920059e.mov

This line throws the error message on the top:

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/5add07673760aa4e2659e828c32c49cc5a1596ef/mlflow/server/js/src/common/utils/ArtifactUtils.js#L40

Thank you @harupy for taking a look! Glad you were able to reproduce the issue. I can see a few ways to proceed, but I'm not sure which the maintainers would prefer:
1. Just remove that `Utils.logErrorAndNotifyUser(error)` line
2. Add a flag in `getArtifactContent` to not call that line
3. Stop requesting the `MLmodel` file every time the model version page loads. (I'm not sure what is done after the file is fetched. Seems like `parseMlModelFile` is called [here](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/server/js/src/model-registry/components/ModelVersionPage.js#L117), but the function just [returns](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/mlflow/server/js/src/model-registry/actions.js#L109) some data that is not used).

Yes I think if we expect this error and we don't want to throw this and silently just log it in console, then the above solution makes sense.

We ideally don't need to change the utils class, we can directly switch `Utils.logErrorAndNotifyUser(error);` in [ArtifactUtils.js](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/5add07673760aa4e2659e828c32c49cc5a1596ef/mlflow/server/js/src/common/utils/ArtifactUtils.js#L40) with `console.error(error)` rather than creating a separate abstraction for it. What do you think?
Thanks everyone for the discussion, I would be happy to put up a PR for this change.
